title: How can I write a director’s script - Quora

response.answer_text: what do you mean by director’s script… that doesn't make any sense… I think what you really trying to say is writing your own script and the same time directing it also… then you are about to play a duel role… as scriptwriter your job remain only to write a screenplay not including camera’s angle kind of stuff… and when you turn into a director role.. all you have to do is visualize how you want to portrait it by adding all those camera’s stuff as ‘PAN’ ‘CLOSE SHOOT’…. my last is advice don’t merge this two role… you just can’t play it at the same time…. that would be a lot of confusion.

If you are a screenwriter you don’t “write” a director’s script. You write a reading script. If you are lucky a director will get to take that script and turn it into a shooting script, which is a road map of shots, sound cues, dialogue, etc that will be used to guide the production phase and translate your reading script into the medium of film (or video). The writer doesn’t write the shooting script. Period.
Not sure what that means. Do you want to write a script and get a director to buy it? Do you want a director to hire you to write one? Do you want to write and direct?
To do that, I suggest looking at this link. http://videoandfilmmaker.com/wp/index.php/tutorials/director-prepares-visual-script-breakdown/
